page.title: 10Topograghy of Westward Ho!
page.content: Large area of seaside type grassland, 600 acres of which 300 are in this block.Backed by wooded hills 300ft. high. Separated from sea and beach by the Pebbleridge. Cliffs to the west designated Site of Special Scientific Interest having raised Hoxnian interglacial period, pebble beach with upper boulders frost-shattered. On the foreshore is a kitchen midden prehistoric, containing domestic artifacts. Nearby beaach cobbles errected on end -frost shattered in the Wurm glaciation period. These may be seen together with a submerged forest only at low Spring tides and when the sands have been washed away. Large seasonal pond approx.1/4 Km. long lies immediately behind the Pebbleridge east of the village.
